sources.name: Gemini Deep Research - In-Depth PC Analysis and Building Guide

entries.fact: DDR5 JEDEC baseline speed is 4800MT/s, with common kits at 5600-6400MT/s
entries.details: DDR4 baseline was 2133MT/s. DDR5 XMP/EXPO profiles typically target 6000-6400MT/s for sweet spot. Intel favors high bandwidth, AMD Ryzen 7000 has sweet spot at ~6000MT/s due to FCLK ratio.

entries.fact: PCIe 5.0 provides 4GB/s per lane (32GT/s), doubling PCIe 4.0
entries.details: x16 slot provides 64GB/s bidirectional. x4 NVMe slot provides 8GB/s. Consumer GPUs don't saturate PCIe 4.0 x16 yet, but NVMe drives benefit from Gen5 x4.

entries.fact: 12VHPWR connector delivers up to 600W to GPUs through single cable
entries.details: 16-pin connector replaces multiple 8-pin cables. Requires 90-degree insertion without wobbling. Melting issues from improper seating prompted design revision to 12V-2x6 with improved latching.

entries.fact: Intel Core i9-14900K: 24 cores (8P+16E), up to 6.0GHz, 253W PL2
entries.details: Raptor Lake Refresh uses Intel 7 process. P-cores use Raptor Cove, E-cores use Gracemont. Hybrid architecture requires Thread Director for optimal scheduling.

entries.fact: AMD Ryzen 9 7950X: 16 cores (32 threads), up to 5.7GHz, 170W TDP
entries.details: Zen 4 on TSMC 5nm with integrated RDNA 2 graphics. Supports DDR5 only, PCIe 5.0. X3D variants add 3D V-Cache for gaming performance.

entries.fact: NVIDIA RTX 4090: 16384 CUDA cores, 24GB GDDR6X, 450W TDP, 1008GB/s bandwidth
entries.details: Ada Lovelace architecture on TSMC 4N. Features 3rd gen RT cores, 4th gen Tensor cores. DLSS 3 with Frame Generation exclusive to 40-series.

entries.fact: AMD RX 7900 XTX: 96 CUs, 24GB GDDR6, 355W TDP, 960GB/s bandwidth
entries.details: RDNA 3 chiplet design with GCD+MCD. Features 2nd gen RT accelerators and AI accelerators. FSR 3 with Frame Generation available.

entries.fact: PCIe 5.0 NVMe SSDs achieve up to 14,000MB/s sequential read
entries.details: Samsung 990 Pro (Gen4): 7450MB/s. Crucial T700 (Gen5): 12,400MB/s. Corsair MP700 Pro (Gen5): 14,500MB/s. Gen5 drives run hot, often require heatsinks.

entries.fact: Quality tower coolers support 200-250W TDP, 360mm AIOs support 350W+
entries.details: Noctua NH-D15: ~250W. be quiet! Dark Rock Pro 5: ~250W. Arctic Liquid Freezer II 360: ~350W. Intel/AMD stock coolers inadequate for high-end CPUs.
